base.name: SharpRoast
author: Russel Van Tuyl (@Ne0nd0g)

options.name: .NetVersion
options.description: The .Net Framework version compiler to use (i.e. v3.0, v3.5, or v4.*)

options.name: Argument
options.description: Argument to perform roast against. See notes for examples

options.name: FileName
options.description: The filename, without the file extension, used for the resulting source code and compiled files

base.description: SharpRoast is a C# port of various PowerView's Kerberoasting functionality. The KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.GetRequest Method() method was contributed to PowerView by @machosec. The hashes are output in hashcat format. This module downloads the project's C# source code, compiles it with .Net's csc.exe, executes it, and then deletes the files.
base.notes:
-SharpRoast was created by Will Schroeder (@harmj0y) and is part of the ðŸ‘» GhostPack tool set: https://github.com/GhostPack/SharpRoast
	-Roast all users in the current domain: SharpRoast.exe all
	-Roast a specific SPN:SharpRoast.exe "asdf/asdfasdf"
	-Roast a specific user in the current domain: SharpRoast.exe harmj0y
	-Roast users from a specified OU in the current domain: SharpRoast.exe "OU=TestingOU,DC=testlab,DC=local"
	-Roast a specific specific SPN in another (trusted) domain: SharpRoast.exe "MSSQLSvc/SQL@dev.testlab.local"
	-Roast all users in another (trusted) domain: SharpRoast.exe "LDAP://DC=dev,DC=testlab,DC=local"
	-Any of these commands also accept a [domain.com\user] [password] for to roast with explicit credentials. For example: SharpRoast.exe harmj0y "testlab.local\dfm" "Password123!"
